revised_title: Redetermination of the True Weight of a Cubic Inch of Distilled Water
tldr: The author conducted experiments to determine the true weight of a cubic inch of distilled water, using three gravimeters and accounting for factors such as temperature, air pressure, and water density. The results showed that the previously accepted weight of a cubic inch of distilled water was too high, and provided a more accurate value for use as a metric unit of volume.
